intro: Senecio haenkeanus, commonly known as the Desert Senecio, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting well to harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, helping to reduce water loss. Senecio haenkeanus is often found in desert scrublands and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations and limited rainfall.
